text: Nastassja Kinski (born January 24, 1961John Sandford (ed) (2001) Encyclopedia of Contemporary German Culture (Routledge world reference): 340)is a German- born American movie actress who has been in more than 60 movies. She is the daughter of German actor Klaus Kinski.Davidson, John E. Deterritorializing the New German Cinema Regents of the University of Minnesota 1999 page 80 Her movie debut was in The Wrong Move in 1975 at the age of 13.Welsh, James Michael; Gene D. Phillips; Rodney Hill The Francis Ford Coppola Encyclopedia Scarecrow Press Inc. Lanham, Maryland 2010 page 154 She starred in 1976 in To the Devil a Daughter.Ellis, Bill Raising the Devil: Satanism, New Religions, and the Media The University Press of Kentucky 2000 page 159 She was also in a television episode of Tatort called Reifezeugnis in 1976. That show was about a teenage girl in love with her teacher.Bach, Hans-Michael; Tim Bergfelder The Concise Cinegraph: Encyclopedia of German Cinema Berghahn Books 2009 page 360 She was then in Boarding School in 1976.Weldon, Michael The Psychotronic Video Guide St. Martin's Press New York New York 1996 page 70 She was also in Cos√¨ come sei, also called Stay as You Are in 1978. She won a Golden Globe Award for her role in Tess. The most recent movie she was in was Inland Empire (2006). ==Personal life== At one point she dated Polish movie director Roman Polanski, who she met on the set of Tess. She had a son with actor Vincent Spano. In the mid-1980s, Kinski met Egyptian movie maker Ibrahim Moussa. They married on September 10, 1984. They had two children. The marriage ended in 1992. From 1992 until 1995, Kinski lived with musician Quincy Jones. In 1993, their daughter was born. ==References== ==Other websites== * Kinski's French language website * Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:German movie actors
title: Nastassja Kinski
